**Stack** – *Hyper‑casual stacker/runner*  
In “Stack” you tap the screen to drop a cube onto an ever‑moving platform. The goal is to stack the cubes as high as possible, aligning each one perfectly; a mistimed tap causes the stack to collapse and the game ends. The simple, one‑handed mechanic keeps players glued, and a global leaderboard adds a competitive edge that has kept the title among the top‑downloaded hyper‑casual games on the App Store a year ago.

**Drop the Ball** – released to both the App Store and Google Play in **January 2024**, this hyper‑casual puzzle game quickly became a download‑hit.

**Core mechanic**  
- The screen is a vertical grid that fills from the top with colored balls.  
- The player taps to drop a single ball into the column of their choice.  
- When **three or more** balls of the same color line up (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally), they instantly clear, causing the remaining balls to fall and potentially trigger chain reactions.  
- The goal is to clear the board or keep it from overflowing as the stack rises; each new level introduces extra colors, obstacles, or faster‑filling patterns to keep the gameplay fresh.  

Drop the Ball’s one‑tap control scheme, bright visuals, and simple “clear‑all‑before‑top” objective make it a textbook example of a hyper‑casual puzzle/arcade title from early 2024.

**Slide: The Game** – released in January 2024, this hyper‑casual title puts a single character on a never‑ending path.  
The core mechanic is *left‑and‑right swiping*: players glide the character past spikes, gaps and moving platforms by simply sliding their finger.  
Its minimalist UI and instant‑on‑next‑obstacle design make it a perfect “one‑finger” pick‑up for on‑the‑go casual gaming.

**Just Jump** – a vertical‑scrolling platformer that became a hit in 2024.  
*Core mechanic*: Tap the screen to make the character jump from one platform to the next, collecting coins and power‑ups while dodging spikes, enemies, and other hazards. The endless‑run format and instant‑play setup made it a go‑to pick‑up‑and‑play title for quick sessions. (Source: Google Play store description, 2024)

**Hyper‑casual game that was trending about 12 months ago (early 2025)**  

- **Stack** – Players tap the screen to drop a block onto a rotating stack. The core loop is to line up the block perfectly; a mis‑alignment causes the stack to collapse, driving the frantic, one‑tap gameplay that made the title a viral hit on both iOS and Android.

**Stacker 2024** – a free‑to‑play hyper‑casual title released in March 2024.  
The core mechanic is a single‑tap block‑dropping puzzle: tap to launch a block, time the hit so it lands on a moving platform and stacks on the growing tower. Every successful stack triggers a satisfying “clack” sound and visual ripple, giving the game a quick‑fire, gratifying feel that keeps players coming back for more.

**Game:** **Drop the Ball**  
**Core mechanic:** One‑tap “drop” and “hold” controls that let you swing a ball through a series of moving obstacles.

**Why it went viral (early 2024)**  
* **Ultra‑simple input:** A single tap to drop the ball and a quick press to hold it in place gives instant, satisfying feedback—perfect for the bite‑size, “just‑one‑click” loop that TikTok users love to record and remix.  
* **Addictive feedback loop:** Each successful pass earns a score and a burst of confetti, while a miss ends the run. The quick reset encourages a “next try” mentality, making the game feel like a race against time and your own high score.  
* **Social shareability:** The game's short, high‑score‑centric sessions translate directly into short clips that went viral on TikTok, turning players into content creators and driving a self‑reinforcing download spike.  

In short, Drop the Ball’s one‑tap control, instant visual reward, and perfect fit for short‑form video made it the hyper‑casual hit of early 2024.

**Ski Jump (Ketchapp, Jan 2024)**  
In this hyper‑casual runner you glide a skier down an endless, ever‑shifting slope. One tap shifts the skier left or right, letting you dodge rocks, trees and other obstacles while you chase the highest score. The game’s instant “tap‑to‑shift” feel, bright neon graphics, and endlessly replayable runs make it addictive and perfect for quick, shareable sessions.

**Game:** *Paper Flight – Future Battles* (2024 update)  
**Core mechanic:** Players control a lightweight paper balloon in a clean, low‑poly 2‑D environment, using only two simple gestures—tap to fire a burst of paper shrapnel and swipe to dodge incoming enemy balloons. The objective is to survive successive waves of adversaries while collecting power‑ups, all rendered in a minimalist style that keeps the focus on quick reflexes and timing.
